summary:
The Security Council:

Recalling previous resolutions on Somalia, particularly 2245 (2015) and 2297 (2016),

Noting the delay in the joint assessment mission on the African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM),

Looking forward to the report by 15 July 2017 and recognizing the need for an extension of AMISOM's authorization,

Determining the situation in Somalia remains a threat to international peace and security,

Acting under Chapter VII of the UN Charter,

1. Authorizes the African Union Member States to maintain AMISOM deployment until 31 August 2017, with a maximum level of 22,126 uniformed personnel, and authorizes AMISOM to take necessary measures to carry out its mandate;
2. Requests the Secretary-General to continue providing logistical support as set out in resolution 2245 (2015);
3. Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
